link.title: HMB School Board Meeting – Tuesday, April 14 @ 4:00pm

body.class: single single-post postid-4203 single-format-standard custom-background unknown

div.p: Posted by Kassy Brough on Mar 16, 2020 in Uncategorized | 0 comments

HMB Public School is continuing to monitor the spread of COVID-19, more commonly known as Coronavirus. We are in regular contact with local and state health officials, as well as other local school districts and colleges, and we are taking direction from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

ul.li: Distance Learning: After implementing our Distance Learning Plan for one week, administrators, teachers, and staff met in a Zoom meeting to discuss our progress. We all feel the distance learning is going well and will continue to improve as we continue to have the opportunities and experiences with it. Teachers will continue to communicate plans for instruction and are providing learning activities through Google Classroom, Microsoft Office 365, Remind, other platforms, and instructional learning packets will be delivered home to students every Monday morning during the closure. Daily check-ins will occur with class advisors and teachers to ensure student participation and engagement. Please encourage and help your students to access their device and communicate with their teachers. Thank you again for your patience and understanding. We look forward to continuing the education of our students. WE MISS YOU! Stay safe and stay connected!

Locker Room Items: Locker room items have been collected and placed into clear plastic bags. We will be providing families and students the opportunity to come to the school and pick up their locker room belongings on Monday and Wednesday this week. We will be setting the bags on tables outside of the south parking lot doors from 10:00am to 12:00pm. Supervision of the belongings will take place during this time. Feel free to come to the school and claim your belongings during the scheduled time.

Food Service: HMB will continue to provide breakfast and lunch throughout the duration of the school closure. As mentioned previously, due to new funding made available to schools this week, we have the pleasure and opportunity to provide meals for all children ages 1-18 who reside in our school district. Communication has been made to all families as we make plans to continue to offer food services to the community. If you were not contacted or have changed your mind, please call the school as soon as possible to be added to the program. We will have meal pickups on Mondays and Wednesdays from 10:00am-12:00pm at two locations; in Hazelton at the school and in Moffit at the post office. The number of meals we provide will contain food for a week.

Social Distancing: Please practice Social Distancing to the best of your ability. We encourage families to avoid public meeting places currently while continuing to practice effective hygiene methods.
Activities: Click on the following link for information and most recent updates from the North Dakota High School Activities Association: March 31 NDHSAA Update
HMB will provide additional information daily throughout this week as we move forward with planning, and remember to refer to the links under More Information below about the Coronavirus.

div.p: First of all, I would to take this opportunity to thank all of the dedicated HMB staff members who have worked tirelessly over the past two weeks to prepare for and adjust to the new and drastic way we function as a school. Everyone is working to make sure all students and their families have everything they need to move forward during this situation. Also, thank you to our amazing students and parents/guardians for your understanding, patience, and support during this time of school closure and transition. We are all in this together and I look forward to facing this challenge with the HMB community as I know we all are resilient, and we will succeed! Stay safe and stay connected! We miss you all so very much!
Please refer to specific updates below:

Please click here to access. The plan was approved and we are able to implement our plan to provide education to HMB students through distance learning during this closure. The approval allows distance instructional hours to count towards our required instructional hours in our school calendar. We will begin Distance Learning on Monday, March 30th. Teachers will be contacting all their students this wee and may have contacted already to begin instruction. All students have received their belongings, devices, and all other school materials they need to begin Distance Learning. Teachers will be communicating plans for instruction and are providing learning activities through Google Classroom, Microsoft Office 365, Remind, other platforms, and instructional learning packets will be delivered home to students every Monday morning during the closure. Daily check-ins will occur with class advisors and teachers to ensure student participation and engagement. Please encourage and help your students to access their device and communicate with their teachers. Thank you again for your patience and understanding. We look forward to continuing the education of our students. WE MISS YOU! Stay safe and stay connected!

We will have meal pickups on Mondays and Wednesdays from 10:00am-12:00pm at two locations; in Hazelton at the school and in Moffit at the post office. The number of meals we provide will contain food for a week.

div.p: We continue to make plans and have plans in place for student belongings and the continued breakfast and lunch program. We will remain in contact and continue to make updates as we keep moving forward! Please refer to our Facebook page as we have made this week HMB Virtual Spirit Week! Let’s keep in touch! Post pictures of your dress up days! We miss you!

ul.li: Food Service: HMB will continue to provide breakfast and lunch throughout the duration of the school closure. As mentioned previously, due to new funding made available to schools this week, we have the pleasure and opportunity to provide meals for all children ages 1-18 who reside in our school district. Communication has been made to all families as we make plans to continue to offer food services to the community. If you were not contacted or have changed your mind, please call the school as soon as possible to be added to the program. We will resume meal pickup on Tuesday, March 24th from 10:00am-12:00pm.

Distance Learning: Teachers continue to make plans for providing education to HMB students. We will be taking this process in an organized and thorough manner. We will communicate our plan as soon as we have all the information we need to move forward with distance learning. Student Chromebooks and iPads will be available for students to use at home during this time.

Student Materials and Belongings: Staff have gathered all student belongings, materials students will need for distance learning, Chromebooks, iPads, and instruments into carry bags. Distribution of the student bags will take place tomorrow, Tuesday, March 24th. Students on a bus route will have their items delivered by the bus drivers. Buses will be departing the school with student bags at approximately 9:00am. Again, students scheduled on a bus route will have their items delivered. The purpose of this is to reduce the number of families coming to the school. All other students will be able to pick up their bags tomorrow between 10:00am and 3:00pm. Distribution doors have been divided among all the grades. Signs will be posted outside to direct you to the correct door to pick up your bags. Staff members will meet students and families outside the doors with the bags. Please do not enter the school building as students and families are not allowed in the building at this time. If bags are not picked up or families are not home when buses drop off, bags will be returned to the school until pick up arrangements can be made. Distribution door assignments are as follows:
Kindergarten and PreK – East Bell Tower Door
1st through 4th grade – East Elementary Main Entrance Door
5th and 6th grade – North Elementary Door
7th and 8th grade – South Main Parking Lot Entrance Door
9th and 10th grade – South Science Classroom Door
11th and 12th grade – Southeast Door
Again, signs will be posted on the correct doors. Thank you and we look forward to all the students receiving their belongings!

Social Distancing: Please practice Social Distancing to the best of your ability. We encourage families to avoid public meeting places currently while continuing to practice effective hygiene methods.

div.p: We held a staff meeting this morning and first of all, I would like to mention that we have a wonderful group of people employed at HMB. The number one concern from our staff is the education of our students and they have empathy for all the families in our community as the number of days without school continue to mount. We all miss the students dearly and are looking forward to the day we are able to see the students again. Today marked a step in the planning process as we inch closer to hit the ground running with distance learning and an entirely new way to educatate students during this unprecedented time. This weekend, take a break from the news and enjoy time outside and with family. During this time, it may be difficult for children of all ages to cope with our current situation in life. Parents Lead have excellent resources for talking to kids about the Coronavirus. Please refer to the Parents Lead website at http://www.parentslead.org/COVID-19. Stay safe and stay connected. We will send more messages this weekend, if needed.

ul.li: Food Service: HMB will continue to provide breakfast and lunch throughout the duration of the school closure. Additionally, due to new funding made available to schools this week, we have the pleasure and opportunity to provide meals for all children ages 1-18 who reside in our school district. Communication will once again be made to all families as we make plans to continue to offer food services to the community. If you were not contacted or have changed your mind, please call the school as soon as possible to be added to the program. We will begin meal pickup again on Monday and will be taking calls until 9:00am to be eligible that day. Once again, we will have meals ready to be picked up from 10:00am-1:00pm.

Distance Learning: Teachers continue to make plans for providing education to HMB students. We will be taking this process in an organized and thorough manner. We will communicate our plan as soon as we have all the information we need to move forward with distance learning. Student Chromebooks will be available for students to use at home during this time.

Student Materials and Belongings: HMB staff will begin gathering student belongings and school materials that students will need during the school closure on Monday, March 23rd. We intend on cleaning out all items in lockers and desks so we can have the ability to deep clean those areas as well without items inside. We will begin the distribution process beginning on Tuesday, March 24th and communication will be made to families while we organize and develop a plan for student belongings, materials, instruments and Chromebooks to be either picked up or delivered.

Social Distancing: Please practice Social Distancing to the best of your ability. We encourage families to avoid public meeting places currently while continuing to practice effective hygiene methods.

Activities: Click on the link below for information from the North Dakota High School Activities Association regarding spring practices: http://www.hmb.k12.nd.us/files/2020/03/COVID-19-Spring-Practices-NDHSAA.pdf
HMB will provide additional information daily throughout this week as we move forward with planning, and remember to refer to the links under More Information below about the Coronavirus.

div.p: Governor Burgum announced today that all K-12 schools in North Dakota will be closed until further notice. We understand the school cancellation is a burden on families, but this is done for the safety and care of children, parents, staff, and community. With this new information from the Governor, more planning and updates are upcoming:

ul.li: School Cancellation: School is canceled until further notice.

Food Service: HMB provided breakfasts and lunches for students this week. We will distribute the meals again next week and will provide additional information on how we will continue the program moving forward as soon as possible. Communication will once again be made to all families as we make plans to continue to offer food services to the community.

Distance Learning: Governor Burgum has signed the executive order to allow distance learning to count toward our instructional time during the school year. Teachers continue to make plans for providing education to HMB students. We will be taking this process in an organized and thorough manner. We will communicate our plan as soon as we have all the information we need to move forward with distance learning. Student Chromebooks will be available for students to use at home during this time.

Student Materials and Belongings: HMB staff will be gathering student belongings and school materials that students will need during the school closure. Communication will be made to families while we organize and develop a plan for student belongings, materials, and Chromebooks to be either picked up or delivered.

Social Distancing: Please practice Social Distancing to the best of your ability. We encourage families to avoid public meeting places currently while continuing to practice effective hygiene methods.
HMB will provide additional information daily throughout this week as we move forward with planning, and remember to refer to the links under More Information below about the Coronavirus.

div.p: Below are today’s updates regarding the Coronavirus (COVID-19) situation. We continue to base our updates on information we receive from the state and federal agencies, including information from Governor Burgum’s daily news conference:

ul.li: School Cancellation: School is canceled through Friday, March 20th, and Governor Burgum announced he plans to have an update on school closures by 4:00pm tomorrow (March 19th).

Food Service: HMB provided two days of breakfasts and lunches for students on Tuesday. We will distribute the meals again on Thursday and families can pick up the meals from 10:00am and 1:00pm. Communication has been made to all families offering grab-and-go breakfast and lunch available for all students, however, you still have the opportunity to be added to the program. Please call the school at 701-782-6231 as soon as possible tomorrow morning.

Distance Learning: Teachers continue to make plans for providing education to HMB students. Again, the plans are being made to prepare for the possibility of extended school closures. We continue to look at all avenues to provide education, including using platforms such as Google Classroom, Office 365, and other online resources, as well as preparing packets of instruction and activities for students to work on at home. We will be taking this process in an organized and thorough manner. We value our students’ education and need to make sure we are prepared to give them the best education we are able to provide.

Safe Return to School: In the event Governor Burgum allows schools to reopen, HMB will follow procedures that will be beneficial to the safety and health of our students and staff. We are currently working on the procedure and will share it when we have all the steps in place.

Social Distancing: Please practice Social Distancing to the best of your ability. We encourage families to avoid public meeting places currently while continuing to practice effective hygiene methods.

HMB will provide additional information daily throughout this week as we receive further direction from Governor Burgum and the North Dakota Department of Health, and remember to refer to the links under More Information below about the Coronavirus.

div.p: In our continued efforts to communicate with you during the Coronavirus (COVID-19) situation, we will update this site daily. Below are updates based on the most recent information we have received today:

ul.li: Instructional Days Forgiven: Last night, Governor Burgum announced that K-12 schools which were closed this week by executive order will not have to make up the instructional time later this school year.

Food Service: HMB provided two days of breakfasts and lunches for students today. Families were able to pick up the meals at the school from 10:00am-1:00pm. We are very pleased with how the program worked out! Thank you so much to all families who participated for your cooperation and understanding. We will distribute the meals again on Thursday during the same time frame. Communication has been made to all families offering grab-and-go breakfast and lunch available for all students, however, you still have the opportunity to be added to the program. Please call the school to do so at 701-782-6231.

Distance Learning: Today, HMB staff contacted all families to determine if they have internet access at home and if they have access to a device. This information is now being used by administration and teachers to begin the planning process for distance learning. HMB is being proactive as there is potential for Governor Burgum to extend school closures and order schools to provide an alternative way to deliver instruction and educate students at home. We are looking at all avenues to provide education, including using platforms such as Google Classroom, Office 365, and other online resources, as well as preparing packets of instruction and activities for students to work on at home. Keep in mind, we have yet to receive this order, but we will be prepared if closures continue.

Safe Return to School: In the event Governor Burgum allows schools to reopen, HMB will follow procedures that will be beneficial to the safety and health of our students and staff. We are currently working on the procedure and will share it when we have all the steps in place.

Social Distancing: Please practice Social Distancing to the best of your ability. We encourage families to avoid public meeting places currently while continuing to practice effective hygiene methods.

HMB will provide additional information daily throughout this week as we receive further direction from Governor Burgum and the North Dakota Department of Health, and remember to refer to the links under More Information below about the Coronavirus.

div.p: Thank you for your patience as we work through this unprecedented situation. HMB Public School continues to work with local, state and national officials regarding the Coronavirus (COVID-19). We are trying to do our part to protect our community and the most susceptible, our elderly and medically fragile populations. We will continue to provide updates on here which includes additional links to keep our community informed, as we determine our next step in this process.
Key information included in this update:

ul.li: School Cancellation: School is canceled for the week of March 16 – 20.
Deep Cleaning: This week the emphasis for our custodial staff, kitchen staff, and bus drivers will be to ensure that we have conducted proper sanitizing and deep cleaning of the building and buses.

Activities: HMB has suspended all after-school activities for this week. This includes athletics, practices, contests, school concerts, activities in our facilities, and activities of those who rent our facilities. There will be no public access to the building until further notice. All fobs have been deactivated.

Communication: HMB is communicating using the Honeywell Instant Alert Notification System when we plan to cancel or open school. Otherwise, we intend to communicate via our school website and Facebook. If you know anyone who is not getting these communications, share information with them directly or direct them here to our website.

Food Service: HMB will be providing breakfast and lunches for students this week. Communication has been made to all families offering grab-and-go breakfast and lunch available for all students. If you have not been contacted, please call the school at 701-782-6231.

Social Distancing: Please practice Social Distancing to the best of your ability. We encourage families to avoid public meeting places currently while continuing to practice effective hygiene methods.
This Week: HMB administration continues to work on plans for academics, online learning, activities, student medications, continued cleaning, and student wellness.
HMB will provide additional information later this week once we receive further direction from Governor Burgum and the North Dakota Department of Health.
